serviceDescription: Photogrammetry is the science and technology of extracting accurate measurements and spatial information from photographs. It transforms 2D images into 3D models, maps, or orthophotos, widely used in surveying, architecture, and remote sensing. By analyzing image overlaps and camera positions, photogrammetry reconstructs real-world objects or terrains with precision. It is essential for applications like topographic mapping, urban planning, and heritage preservation.

articles.title: GIS Applications
articles.description: integrate high-resolution 3D models and orthophotos into spatial analyses and mapping. They support urban planning, infrastructure monitoring, and environmental management with accurate geospatial data. Photogrammetry enhances GIS workflows by providing precise terrain and feature measurements for informed decision-making.
